name: Hyatt Place Denver Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hyatt for Memorial weekend and I had a blast w/
reviews.title: Liquor Store with in WALKING distance!!!!

likes.liked: — I like that the liquor store was across the street.

reviews.text: the local places. First of all there was a great liquor store across the street that was very friendly with everyone coming in and there
reviews.title: Mixed Bag
A perfect stay!!
reviews.text: was a great mexican restaraunt. Great place located near the
Airport. The rooms were clean, service a little slow.
reviews.title: Great Place for Business Travellers!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a renovated Amerisuites near Denver airport and the I 225/70 junction. The desk staff are pleasant but slow and inefficient; they complained about their computer system and how slow it was...they are right. The lobby is small and pleasant ly decorated with a small bar and sitting area. Room are attractively decorated/updated with a large sitting area, a huge flatscreen TV, comfortable beds and a small bathroom/sink area, outfitted with lots of towels but few amenities. The bathrooms look like they belong to another hotel; an old bathtub and toilet and cramped space, poor lighting, with dirty glasses. Avoid a room near the elevator, you will hear traffic and elevator beeping clearly in your room. The hotel offers a comlimentary continental breakfast, standard "low rent fare" and you can also order hot food (which I did not do). I was charged $199/night, excessive for the room and hotel; worse, the previous occupant paid $89 for the same room, also on a weekday. How do I know? His receipt was left on the desk in the room for me to see!
reviews.title: Wasn't ready to leave!

likes.disliked: — Only 30 TV channels. Movies and music all available if you're willing to pay for it.

reviews.text: I chose to stay here because it seemed as if Hyatt had really figured out what the business travels wants. But Hyatt Place is not all it is cracked up to be, and they don't even do some of the basics very well.
reviews.title: Wouldn't stay here again

reviews.text: First, they lost my reservation. After dealing with a dubious check-in staff member, I had to go on-line, find my confirmation and print it out to prove that I had a reservation. So it took about 20 minutes to check in - a pain after a long day of travel.
reviews.title: Like an expensive boutique hotel

reviews.text: There is a shuttle from the airport, but it doesn't run constantly, so you have to call the hotel, ask them to come get you, and then wait for the guy to come pick you up.
reviews.title: Well...we TRIED to stay there.

likes.disliked: — You gave MY ROOM away to someone else depsite my guaranteeing late arrival

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I finally had checked in, the person behind the desk and said, "There you are Mrs. (my last name), you are in Room 405." This is kind of a basic of hotel security - you don't say the guests name out loud and you never say the room number out loud. Picky - but while they were designing the rooms, why didn't they train the staff?
reviews.title: Pleased with our stay

likes.liked: — Location near airport, sleek stylish rooms
likes.disliked: — odd timing for aiport shuttle, need to sign up in advance for airport shuttle

reviews.text: And - finally - if you are working on your computer, you can't see the TV. The screen is large and gorgeous, but if you can't glance at the news while you are responding to e-mails, it doesn't make much sense.
reviews.title: great tv, poor quality breakfast

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed there with our five teenage boys. We booked two adjoining rooms. Everybody loved it, and teenagers are hard to please. The hotel has been totally renovated with very modern touches: HD flat screen TV, trendy furniture and fixtures, colorful. The rooms were suite style so two double beds and a living room.
reviews.title: Loved the place

likes.liked: — Modern upgrade. Good affordable hotel near airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was very helpful. No restaurant but good restaurants right across the street. Also great value ($129/night). 4:45am (!)shuttle to airport was right on time and very helpful. All in all, highly recommend.
reviews.title: Excellent for the Price

likes.liked: — see the review for all the perks
likes.disliked: — one minor complaint: the refrigerator wasn't working properly

reviews.text: We stayed one night prior to an early flight. I won the room bidding through Priceline for $50. I had stayed at the Tampa Airport Hyatt Place and also had a good experience. I like the chain. Staff was courteous and efficient. The room was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Very nice place.

likes.disliked: — Silly, but there was no book on Hyatt properties or the Denver area.

reviews.text: There are many perks with staying at this Hyatt Place:
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised, but still a few kinks

reviews.text: -Large 42" LG HD TV with a nice variety of HD channels.
reviews.title: Mostly Positive Experience!

likes.liked: — The relatively large indoor pool, the large television screen.
likes.disliked: — a little traffic noise, though not bad.

reviews.text: Spent 5 days at the hotel on a business trip and soon felt comfortable. The room are large, clean and well equipped, comfortable bed, good heating (outside temperatures were almost arctic, down to minus 29 Celsius). Coffee maker and ironing board in the room I used daily. Large flat screen television, unfortunately no international programs such as BBC, also no Spanish programs. Fresh newspaper every morning (except one morning missing). Minibar empty, but vending machine on the floor. Housekeeping good. The hotel staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful, many speak Spanish as well. There is no restaurant except snacks at the bar I didn't try, but some in walking distance, with reasonable prices and friendly service. Breakfast is typically American, and as European I missed some crusty bread or assortment of cheese, but otherwise ok. The "business center" consists of two computers with free of charge internet and one printer. Check in and out are efficient. The lobby is a bit draughty in winter. A shuttle bus to airport. No smoking in hotel, but ashtrays at various exits (smokers, mind it can be very cold in Denver in winter!).
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel for Business Trip

likes.liked: — large room with big beds and coffee maker, quiet location, friendly staff

reviews.title: Very pleasantly surprised....
reviews.text: We have stayed at many of the popular hotel chains in a variety of locations over the last several years. This is by far the best experience we have had for a hotel in this price range. We were greeted by friendly staff and were given a mini-tour of the lobby and were given complimentary bottles of water (which is very helpful in Denver!). We reserved connecting rooms because we had 3 teenagers with us and we wanted some privacy. The rooms were very welcoming, large, exceptionally clean (I always check for bed-bugs) and has so many amenties that we were shocked. The teenagers are typically not very impressed since they have been to many hotels but they were even commenting on how nice the rooms were; plasma tv, sectional with pull-out sofa, lots of extra linens and pillow-cases, mini-fridge etc. Location was great as well, close enough and easy to get to airport, looks like a newer area of Denver in a business park type area but also had decent family restaurants nearby, Outback, Applebees, Einstein Bagels, Starbucks etc. Would stay here again and would recommend to friends. We are thinking we will make a habit out of staying at Hyatt Places as long as the quality remains. Only negative: exceptionally small commode/shower area- if someone was on the larger side, may be difficult to close the door. That is certainly something I can live with when considering the whole picture.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best things about the Hyatt Place DIA are the staff (super helpful and friendly) and the rooms (newly refurbished with a very comfortable bed, a 42 inch plasma TV and an L-shaped sofa to lounge on). For the price we paid (less than $100 for a king bed room), it was excellent value. It's about a 15 minute shuttle ride from DIA, so not as handy as some of the airport hotels, but there's a decent selection of restaurants nearby including a Mexican place, a pizza restaurant and an Outback Steakhouse that will deliver food to your room. You can also order food, wine and beer in the hotel using a touchscreen system in the lobby, and there's a liquor store across the street with a decent selection of wine and beer. The complementary breakfast (which starts at 6am) is your standard cereal-fruit-bagel deal but you can order something more substantial if you want to, using the touchscreen system. The only downside I can think of was the fact that the shuttle only runs every 45 minutes in the morning, so you may have to head to DIA a little sooner than planned. However that is often a good idea given the time it takes to get through DIA security these days.
reviews.title: A comfy bed, a big TV and a sofa for less than $100: what more do you need?

reviews.text: This is a nice mid-range property. Despite its location name, it is not all that close to the Denver Airport, but nothing is. This location is in a suburban office park with a large number of mid-range hotel brands nearby. Also nearby are the usual assortment of chain restaurants; a Ted's Montana Grill shares the parking lot.
reviews.title: Nice, but not exciting

reviews.text: The property is newly renovated and the rooms ar nice and fairly big and have a refridgerator, but no micorwave. The rooms have an enourmous (50" or so) flat screen TV, which is great, but actually a bit overwhelming. Nice continental breakfast, which is included in the rate. Small fitness room, but new equipment.
reviews.title: Not the best, but ok

likes.liked: — close to airport, easy for an early flight
likes.disliked: — lots of things weren't working and the staff weren't very helpful / welcoming

aka: Hyatt Place Denver Airport Hotel Aurora
